snippet: During a rare appearance before lawmakers Thursday morning, Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy admitted errors but denied widespread corruption in his governing party.
abstract: Spain’s embattled prime minister Mariano Rajoy, during rare appearance before lawmakers, admits he erred by trusting accountant now jailed for hiding millions of euros in Swiss bank account; denies widespread corruption in his governing Popular Party and rejects calls to resign.

byline.contributor: Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: During a rare appearance before lawmakers Thursday morning, Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy admitted errors but denied widespread corruption in his governing party.

headline.main: Spain’s Premier Says He Erred, but Rejects Calls to Step Down
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Premier Says He Erred, But Rejects Calls to Step Down
